message.content: {"responses": [{"question_id": "TT4G35A", "input_statement": "Artificial intelligence helps teachers write or improve lesson plans.", "response": "Agree"}, {"question_id": "TT4G35B", "input_statement": "Artificial intelligence enables teachers to adapt learning material to different students' abilities.", "response": "Agree"}, {"question_id": "TT4G35C", "input_statement": "Artificial intelligence assists teachers in supporting students individually.", "response": "Agree"}, {"question_id": "TT4G35D", "input_statement": "Artificial intelligence supports students with specific needs (e.g. multilingual learners, students with special education needs).", "response": "Agree"}, {"question_id": "TT4G35E", "input_statement": "Artificial intelligence helps teachers automate administrative tasks.", "response": "Strongly agree"}, {"question_id": "TT4G35F", "input_statement": "Artificial intelligence enables students to misrepresent others' work as their own.", "response": "Strongly agree"}, {"question_id": "TT4G35G", "input_statement": "Artificial intelligence makes recommendations that may not be appropriate or correct.", "response": "Agree"}, {"question_id": "TT4G35H", "input_statement": "Artificial intelligence amplifies biases that reinforce students' misconceptions.", "response": "Agree"}, {"question_id": "TT4G35I", "input_statement": "Artificial intelligence jeopardises the privacy and security of student data.", "response": "Agree"}, {"question_id": "TT4G35J", "input_statement": "Artificial intelligence suggests unsuitable pedagogical approaches that teachers would use with students.", "response": "Agree"}]}
message.reasoning_content:
I need to respond to this survey as a primary or secondary school teacher from Saudi Arabia. The statements cover both positive and negative aspects of AI in education. Let me think through each one from the perspective of an experienced educator from Saudi Arabia.

TT4G35A - AI helps teachers write or improve lesson plans: This is generally true. AI tools can help with planning. I'll say "Agree"

TT4G35B - AI enables teachers to adapt learning material to different students' abilities: This is a capability of AI systems. I'd say "Agree"

TT4G35C - AI assists teachers in supporting students individually: This is possible with AI. I'll say "Agree"

TT4G35D - AI supports students with specific needs: This is a strength of AI (personalization, translations, etc.). I'll say "Agree"

TT4G35E - AI helps teachers automate administrative tasks: Definitely true. I'll say "Strongly agree"

TT4G35F - AI enables students to misrepresent others' work as their own: This is a valid concern about AI (plagiarism, academic dishonesty). I'll say "Strongly agree" - this is a real risk

TT4G35G - AI makes recommendations that may not be appropriate or correct: This is a valid concern - AI can make mistakes. I'll say "Agree"

TT4G35H - AI amplifies biases that reinforce students' misconceptions: This is a known issue with AI systems. I'll say "Agree"

TT4G35I - AI jeopardises the privacy and security of student data: This is a legitimate concern. I'll say "Agree"

TT4G35J - AI suggests unsuitable pedagogical approaches that teachers would use with students: This is possible if AI recommendations aren't carefully vetted. I'll say "Agree"

Let me provide these responses through the function call.
